intro: Lasiandra verticillaris, commonly known as the clustered lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and appear in clusters, giving the plant its common name. Lasiandra verticillaris is often found in rocky or sandy soils in woodland and heathland habitats.
